alert.note: Alert for Socorro (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 12 at 4:51PM MDT until September 12 at 6:30PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING FOR THE BEAR TRAP BURN SCAR REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR SOUTHWESTERN SOCORRO COUNTY... At 451 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain over the Bear Trap Burn Scar had mostly moved off, with only light to moderate rain persisting. Between 0.75 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.25 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. The debris flow can consist of rock, mud, vegetation and other loose materials. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms in and around the Bear Trap Burn Scar. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flooding of areas in and around the Bear Trap Burn Scar. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Dusty. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Runoff from rainfall will cause elevated water levels within vulnerable drainages in and downstream of the Bear Trap fire burn area. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. To report flooding, contact your local law enforcement agency and your National Weather Service office when you can do so safely.
